class Accounts.API.viewsets.UserViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: ModelViewSet

View class for user data.

serializer_class¶

Serializer for the user data.

Type:

UserSerializer

queryset¶

Queryset that includes all objects of the CustomUser_DBTable model.

Type:

QuerySet

create(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Method to create a new user.

Parameters:

  • request (rest_framework.request.Request) – The request object.

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Returns:

HTTP response with the new user data if the user was created successfully, otherwise an error message.

Return type:

rest_framework.response.Response

Raises:

HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED – If the user is not part of the ‘Gestor da empresa’ or ‘Admins’ groups.

queryset¶
serializer_class¶

alias of UserSerializer

class Accounts.views.IsAutenticatedView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: APIView

View class for checking if a user is authenticated.

\*\*APIView

Base class for all views in the REST API.

Type:

rest_framework.views.APIView**

\*\*get(request: rest_framework.request.Request) -> rest_framework.response.Response**

Method to check if a user is authenticated. Returns an HTTP response with a message indicating whether the user is authenticated or not.

get(request)¶
class Accounts.views.LoginView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: APIView

View class for user authentication.

\*\*APIView

Base class for all views in the REST API.

Type:

rest_framework.views.APIView**

\*\*AnonRateThrottle

Rate control class for anonymous users.

Type:

rest_framework.throttling.AnonRateThrottle**

\*\*post(request: rest_framework.request.Request) -> rest_framework.response.Response**

Method to authenticate a user. Returns an HTTP response with access and refresh token if authentication is successful, otherwise an error message.

post(request)¶

Authenticates a user based on their email and password.

Parameters:

request (rest_framework.request.Request) – HTTP request object.

Returns:

HTTP response with access and refresh token if authentication is successful, otherwise an error message.

Return type:

rest_framework.response.Response

Request:

POST api url/opitoken/

Request body:

{“email”: “email”, “password”: “password”} Use the user’s email and password for authentication.

throttle_Classes = [<class 'rest_framework.throttling.AnonRateThrottle'>]¶
class Accounts.views.RefreshTokenView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: TokenObtainPairView

View class for refreshing an access token.

\*\*TokenObtainPairView

Base class for views that provides a method to obtain access and refresh tokens.

Type:

rest_framework_simplejwt.views.TokenObtainPairView**

\*\*post(request: rest_framework.request.Request, \*args, \*\*kwargs) -> rest_framework.response.Response**

Method to refresh an access token. Returns an HTTP response with a new access token if the refresh token is valid, otherwise an error message.

post(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

class Accounts.models.Company_DBTable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Model representing a company.

\*\*company_name

The name of the company. It’s unique and has a maximum length of 50 characters.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*CNPJ

The CNPJ of the company. CNPJ is the Brazilian company identification number.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*address

The address of the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*city

The city where the company is located. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*state

The state where the company is located. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*telephone

The telephone number of the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.BigIntegerField**

\*\*logotipo

The logo of the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.ImageField**

\*\*users

The users associated with the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.ManyToManyField**

\*\*plan

The plan associated with the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.ForeignKey**

\*\*site

The website of the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.URLField**

\*\*comercial_email

The commercial email of the company. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.EmailField**

CNPJ¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

customuser_dbtable_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

dropboxanswerlist_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

logotipo¶

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

class Accounts.models.CustomUser_DBTable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractUser, PermissionsMixin

Model representing a custom user.

\*\*email

The user’s email. It’s unique and used as the username field.

Type:

models.EmailField**

\*\*firstName

The user’s first name.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*lastName

The user’s last name.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*profileImage

The user’s profile image.

Type:

models.ImageField**

\*\*CompanyPosition

The user’s position in the company.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*birthDate

The user’s birth date.

Type:

models.DateField**

\*\*CPF

The user’s CPF (Brazilian individual taxpayer registry identification).

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*telephone

The user’s telephone number.

Type:

models.BigIntegerField**

\*\*companyId

Reference to the company the user belongs to.

Type:

models.ForeignKey**

\*\*groups

Groups the user belongs to. A user will get all permissions granted to each of their groups.

Type:

models.ManyToManyField**

\*\*user_permissions

Specific permissions for this user.

Type:

models.ManyToManyField**

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class Accounts.models.Plans_DBTable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Model representing a plan.

\*\*plan_name

The name of the plan. It’s unique and has a maximum length of 50 characters.

Type:

models.CharField**

\*\*price

The price of the plan.

Type:

models.DecimalField**

\*\*description

A detailed description of the plan. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.TextField**

\*\*users_limit

The limit of users for the plan. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.IntegerField**

\*\*storage_limit

The storage limit for the plan. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.IntegerField**

\*\*projects_limit

The limit of projects for the plan. This field can be left blank.

Type:

models.IntegerField**

class Accounts.models.UserManager(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: BaseUserManager

create_superuser(email, companyId, password, **extra_fields)¶
create_user(email, companyId, password=None, **extra_fields)¶
use_in_migrations = True¶

If set to True the manager will be serialized into migrations and will thus be available in e.g. RunPython operations.
